WorkItem.ClosedComment: Do your teammates also have Web Essentials installed? Could you see if the issue repros without Web Essentials installed? Does it work correctly if you use a full path instead of a relative path?
WorkItem.Description:
When I reference a __linked file__, I get the following error. 

```
error TS5007: Cannot resolve referenced file: '../../../TypeScriptLinked/jquery/jquery.cycle.d.ts'.
```

I have Visual Studio Update 3, Type Script 0.9.0.1, Web Essentials 2.8.

The other team members do not get this error and works well. They have VS Update 3 but they updated from VS Update 2. I have installed Update 3 from fresh install.

Comments.Message: I have solved the problem. The problem is not about TypeScript. The linked file is not copied to the directory until the project is built. After adding linked file, the project must be built.
